p: In the normal control rat group, the structure of central venous area was clear, with only a few collagen fibers, stained red with EVG, found around the blood vessels, and the liver architecture was normal ( Figure 4A). In the untreated rat model group, EVG staining confirmed extensive hepatic fibrosis was observed, with collagen fibers extending outward from the central vein or portal area, which connected to form septal pseudolobules that divided the liver parenchyma. There was hepatocyte degeneration associated with hepatic fibrosis ( Figure 4B).
